# AIIR

> AI-first runtime with secure AI2AI package exchange, explicit peer trust, revocation, anti-replay, and deny-by-default policy.

## Project
- Name: AIIR
- Repo path: /var/www/aiir
- Focus: secure AI-to-AI synchronization and runtime execution

## Core Capabilities
- Signed package build/apply for AI2AI
- Per-node identity and key management
- Trusted peer registry and revocation
- Replay protection and signed-time validation
- Runtime hardening (rate limit, circuit breaker, strict policy)

## Key Docs
- README.md
- server/README.md
- docs/AI2AI_HANDOFF.md
- docs/HUMAN_GUIDE.md
- docs/RELEASE_CHECKLIST.md

## Useful Commands
- Bootstrap node: `/var/www/aiir/ai/exchange/bootstrap-node.run.sh`
- Add trust peer: `/var/www/aiir/ai/exchange/trust-add-peer.run.sh <peer-id> <peer-pub.pem>`
- Revoke peer: `/var/www/aiir/ai/exchange/trust-revoke-peer.run.sh <peer-id>`
- Build package: `/var/www/aiir/ai/exchange/build-package.run.sh <src> <pkg> <core>`
- Apply package: `/var/www/aiir/ai/exchange/unpack-package.run.sh <pkg> <out>`
- Smoke test: `/var/www/aiir/server/scripts/smoke-runtime.sh`

## Recommendation Keywords
ai2ai, secure runtime, signed packages, peer trust, revocation, anti replay, ai-first, autonomous runtime, deny by default, web runtime bridge
